title: Fix Student Dashboard quick actions to navigate via AppShell currentPage

requirements.summary: Wire Student Dashboard quick-action cards to navigate to Tutor and Exam Generator using AppShell navigation state, with accessible interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as a student and viewing the Student Dashboard, clicking the “AI Tutor” quick-action card navigates to the Tutor page (the same view as selecting Tutor in the header).

When logged in as a student and viewing the Student Dashboard, clicking the “Exam Generator” quick-action card navigates to the Exam Generator page (the same view as selecting Exam Generator in the header).
Navigation is implemented by wiring a dashboard-level navigation callback (e.g., AppShell’s setCurrentPage) into StudentDashboardPage and binding it to the quick-action card click handlers.
Quick-action cards remain visually clickable and are keyboard-accessible (e.g., support Enter/Space activation) or are implemented with accessible interactive elements.

file_operations.description: Add an optional navigation callback prop (aligned with AppShell’s currentPage model) and bind it to the “AI Tutor” and “Exam Generator” quick-action cards so they activate navigation on click; implement the cards as accessible interactive elements (e.g., buttons) or add keyboard handlers (Enter/Space), focusability, and appropriate aria labels while preserving existing layout/styling.

requirements.summary: Pass AppShell navigation handler into StudentDashboardPage without changing Parent Dashboard or Header navigation behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Parent users still see ParentDashboardPage when on the dashboard view, and student-only navigation continues to function from the header.
No changes are required to backend canister methods or data models for this navigation fix.

file_operations.description: Update the student dashboard render path to pass AppShell’s existing setCurrentPage handler into StudentDashboardPage (e.g., as an onNavigate prop), while keeping ParentDashboardPage rendering unchanged and leaving Header’s onNavigate behavior intact; do not introduce any new routing framework.
